function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limitations in increasing ventilation rates during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high concentration of virus-laden air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of ventilation as a critical method for reducing airborne transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate distribution of ventilation leading to inadequate dilution of contaminated air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient emphasis on protection from small, virus-laden, airborne droplets by international health organizations like the who, rehva, and ashrae.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in quantitatively comparing and concluding the most significant transmission route for viruses in a given situation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of recommendations and engineering controls to reduce the potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 and other airborne viruses.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of contagious diseases such as tuberculosis, measles, chickenpox, sars-cov, mers-cov, rsv, and influenza.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral loads found in personal samplers worn by the sampling team when in the presence of a patient receiving oxygen via nasal cannula, indicating potential airborne transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of direct confirmatory evidence of self-inoculation into mucous membranes as the end-stage pathway to infection through droplet and contact transmission routes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incongruity in the level of evidence required to demonstrate airborne transmission compared to other transmission modes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral rna presence in air samples","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for unexpected major disruptions in the supply chain","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gaps in academic literature related to collaboration, technology adoption, and knowledge creation in supply chain management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited scope of literature search due to use of only one database scopus .","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Exclusion of papers published after 2020 may result in missing recent developments and insights related to supply chain management strategies during and after the covid-19 outbreak.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption about the impact of population vaccination on supply chain and logistics management strategies without concrete evidence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exploratory studies may not identify all potential drivers of contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prescriptive view may not effectively optimize resources for disease mitigation in the built environment.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Predictive approaches may not accurately anticipate the future impact and likelihood of contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and understanding about supply chain interactions and effects among stakeholders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Slow adoption and diffusion of technology and policy changes across the supply chain, especially among less tech-savvy stakeholders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of multi-disciplinary workgroups to address prioritized needs and problems in supply chain management","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disruptions in production due to decreasing availability of essential raw materials and staff","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in demand patterns leading to disruptions in distribution and scm","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of agility and adaptability in traditional companies with products or demand that do not change continuously","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in supply chain network design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on just-in-time manufacturing philosophy","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-collaborative structures in supply chain","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 outbreak and its impact on supply chains","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of focus on nox-, sox-related emissions and particle matter","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of closed-loop supply chains and circular economy models in certain sectors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to lack of health measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased social issues leading to disparities and malnutrition","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental impact leading to resource depletion and waste generation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for major external disruptions within the supply chain","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of knowledge-based systems for training and knowledge management","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate performance evaluation for long-term sustainability","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"A wider spread disruption such as a continental-wide pandemic could impact a variety of locations and stakeholders.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Characteristics of the supply chain, including logistic operations, network structure, dynamics, and complexity, determine the way major external disruptions may change performance within the supply chain.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interactions among supply chain stakeholders drive decision-making and actions, impacting the frequency, intensity, duration, and spread patterns of disruptions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in global and local supply chains","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Volatile economic situations affecting manufacturing and logistics sectors","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of disruptions on focal organization in supply chain","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of agility, adaptability, and alignment in supply chains","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global disruptions impacting supply chains at operational, tactical, and strategic levels","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to measure long-term sustainability and performance in supply chains","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Implicit assumption that supply chains are not affected by major disruptions like covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
